org.cleverbus.core.common.asynch
Class AsynchInMessageRoute

java.lang.Object
  org.apache.camel.builder.BuilderSupport
      org.apache.camel.builder.RouteBuilder
          org.apache.camel.spring.SpringRouteBuilder
              org.cleverbus.api.route.AbstractBasicRoute
                  org.cleverbus.core.common.asynch.AsynchInMessageRoute
All Implemented Interfaces:
org.apache.camel.RoutesBuilder, Aware, ApplicationContextAware
@CamelConfiguration(value="inMsgRouteBean")
public class AsynchInMessageRoute
extends AbstractBasicRoute

Route definition that processes incoming asynchronous message and make the following steps:

  1. parse trace (SOAP) header from the request
  2. creates Message entity
  3. check throttling
  4. saves Message into db
  5. creates OK/FAIL response
If everything works fine then the message is asynchronously redirected for next processing without need to take it from message queue.

Author:
Petr Juza
See Also:
AsynchResponseProcessor

Method Detail

doConfigure

public void doConfigure()
                 throws Exception
Route for incoming asynchronous message input operation.

Prerequisite: defined message headers AsynchConstants.SERVICE_HEADER, AsynchConstants.OPERATION_HEADER and optional AsynchConstants.OBJECT_ID_HEADER

Output: CallbackResponse for OK message or fill "" exchange property if error occurred

Specified by:
doConfigure in class AbstractBasicRoute
Throws:
Exception - can be thrown during configuration

isMsgInGuaranteedOrder

@Handler
public boolean isMsgInGuaranteedOrder(@Body
                                              Message msg)
Checks if specified message should be processed in guaranteed order and if yes then checks if the message is in the right order.

Parameters:
msg - the asynchronous message
Returns:
true if message's order is ok otherwise false

saveLogContextParams

@Handler
public void saveLogContextParams(@Body
                                         Message msg,
                                         @Headers
                                         Map<String,Object> headers)
Saves log request ID into header LogContextFilter.CTX_REQUEST_ID. It's because child threads don't inherits this information from parent thread automatically.

Parameters:
msg - the message
headers - the incoming message headers
